title: India considers banning news identified as 'fake' by govt on social media
summary: India's government has proposed new IT rules that would prohibit social media platforms from hosting content that the government deems false or misleading. The draft proposal represents an expansion of government control over online content.
content:
India's government has announced plans to prohibit social media platforms from hosting any information that it identifies as false, according to a draft proposal of new IT rules released this week.

The proposed regulations would give the government broad powers to require social media companies to remove content that officials determine to be misleading or false information. This marks the latest move in India's expanding oversight of digital platforms and online content.

The draft rules were released amid growing concerns globally about the spread of misinformation on social media and debates over who should have the authority to determine what constitutes false information.
